p: Justification for use of a particular crop model in an ensemble can come entirely from a-priori reasoning â€“ i.e. demonstration that the model is fit for purpose, as outlined in Section 3. However, in the context of an ensemble a second criterion presents itself: to what extent will that model contribute to the correct capturing of the underlying distribution of probabilities (as illustrated in Fig. 3 and outlined in Section 2)? Whilst all ensembles are to some extent ensembles of opportunity, they should not be entirely ad hoc. Rather, ensembles should be formed from a well-justified set of models and input data (see Section 2.2 of the supplementary information). As part of this, usually any climate model data used as input will be bias-corrected (see Section 2.3 of the supplementary information).
